reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Delightful Christmas Story!
reviews.reviewText: Have you ever met anyone who seemed cranky at first but was really a wonderful person once you got to know them? I worked at my local Dime Store in high school with an older woman named Ann. She seemed very cranky when I first started working at the Dime Store, but as I got to know her, she turned out to be a wonderful person who has a reason to be cranky (her beloved husband died young).Jack Frost is this type of story. Lindsay Calhoun’s family is on a cruise, and she will be spending Christmas alone. She volunteers to organize the office Christmas party. The office scrooge, Jack, is not happy about an office Christmas party and always seems grumpy. When the power goes out as the two are tying up things at the end of the party, they find themselves trapped together in the office. As they get to know each other better, they begin to really understand one another. Will love blossom between these two?Jack Frost was the November pick for the Brenda Novak Book Group, but I didn’t get to it until December. It was a perfect light and uplifting Christmas book, perfect for the season. I think this one would make a great Hallmark movie. Lisa Negron was a good narrator.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
reviews.reviewText: In my life I have known people like Jack Frost and, could never understand why they act like that however since I never took the time to get to know them I would just ignore them. If I had gotten to know them better I might have had a new friend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Feel Good Holiday Romance
reviews.reviewText: I’ve loved reading Debbie Macomber books for years and this was no different. This was an adorable Grumpy/Sunshine story that’s perfect for a quick pick me up. Her books are wholesome and tell a beautiful story, and this one is no different.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome book. Couldn't put it down.
reviews.reviewText: It was an easy read. Everything just flowed. Awesome story of the thawing of Jack Frost.i love all of Debbie's books, been reading her for many years.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Sweet But Way Too Short
reviews.reviewText: Lindsey is cheerful and full of good deeds and kind words. Jack is a bit of a grump. He is sarcastic and mostly has a bad attitude about just about everything.Lindsey volunteered to organize the office Christmas party. Jack was told by his boss that the party was mandatory. And the boss planned to hand out Christmas bonuses at the party. So, everyone at the office attended. The office was virtual, and the bosses had let the lease expire without renewal. So, weekly status meetings were the only contact the coworkers had. Lindsey planned a lot of ice breaker games, and the coworkers felt more familiar after the games. The building Lindsey rented for the party had been a bank. After the party, Lindsey stayed to clean up. Jack lost his keys. He offered to help clean up. She said she was going to come back and clean the next day. As they were about to leave, the lights went out and the doors locked. They were stuck together for the night.Debbie Macomber always gives her readers an early Christmas present…a wonderful Christmas book. This year it was a novella. I love her Christmas stories so much that I wish it had been a longer story.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I should have read the description better and I would have known its only 61 pages plus a few recipes…..When I got it out of the amazon box I thought it was a pamphlet they’d thrown in and was surprised it was a book lol! 😆

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I just loved this book. Could not put it down. Very well writtenThis is the smallest book I have ever read. I was disappointed when I saw how small but at the end I loved it.Lots of laughs -

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024

reviews.reviewText: Lindsay and her co-workers are meeting on zoom rather thancoming into the office. Jack is a new employee and keeps tohimself.Lindsay volunteered to co-ordinate the Christmas party forthe staff. She rents an old banking buildinng.All were excited to get together except Jack.The night of the party, there was a snow storm and allof the party goers were leaving before they got snowed it.Jack can back looking for his keys.Being an old banking building, the locks on the doors wereon a timer. Thus Lindsay and Jack find themselves stuckin the bank. Then the hydro goes out.What will happen? Will they be found?

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 9, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I thought this book would be a big book with lots of pages!! How disappointing, can read this in an hour, its that small. not worth over a £10 i paid, not happy

Debbie Macomber nous offre chaque année un roman de Noël. Cette année, alors qu’elle devait prendre sa retraite et ne plus écrire, elle nous offre une nouvelle. Pas assez long à mon goût mais c’est mieux que rien du tout.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 18, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Very short story about 61 pages and it cost almost £10!
